resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: [Packaging] Dependency resolution issues in the nightly conda builds

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
It seems many of the conda packaging nightly builds are failing due to conda dependency resolution errors, example here:
https://dev.azure.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/_build/results?buildId=12793&view=logs&j=0da5d1d9-276d-5173-c4c4-9d4d4ed14fdb&t=d9b15392-e4ce-5e4c-0c8c-b69645229181&l=3049

comments.body: This seems to be a general conda/conda-build issue with the release of OpenSSL 3.0. Not all dependencies of arrow-cpp support it yet but conda aggressively updates it to 3.0 and thus generates the conflicts.

Once the upstream issue is resolved, remove the tasknames with `~` in front of them to re-add these to our nightly set: https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/987d47adb0a2c277ae7fe665cac844a42e6f64c4/dev/tasks/tasks.yml#L146-L159
